channel.title: BBC Sport
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see https://www.bbc.co.uk/usingthebbc/terms-of-use/#15metadataandrssfeeds for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Mensik upsets Sinner to reach Qatar semi-finals
item.description: Jakub Mensik prevents Jannik Sinner from reaching another final as he knocks the world number two out of the Qatar Open quarter-finals, while Carlos Alcaraz reaches semis.

item.title: Badosa hits back at claim of 'disrespectful' retirement
item.description: Former world number two Paula Badosa responds to a suggestion she is "disrespectful to the game" following her withdrawal in Dubai.

item.title: Sinner and Alcaraz reach Qatar quarter-finals
item.description: Jannik Sinner and Carlos Alcaraz remain on course to meet in the Qatar Open final after both claim straight-set wins on Wednesday to reach the last eight.

item.title: People shouldn't be dying in streets just for existing - Gauff on US issues
item.description: Coco Gauff says it is "tough to wake up" and see what is happening back home in the United States amid the president's immigration crackdown.

item.title: England legend Carney & tennis great Clijsters part of Birmingham takeover
item.description: Birmingham City's owners take over the women's team, with England legend Karen Carney among the minority investors.

item.title: Draper cruises to Davis Cup win on return from injury
item.description: Jack Draper cruises to an emphatic victory on his long-awaited return from injury to give Great Britain the lead over Norway in Davis Cup qualifying.

item.title: Alcaraz wins 'difficult' first match since Melbourne triumph
item.description: Carlos Alcaraz says he had to get through some "difficult moments" in a 6-4 7-6 (7-5) win against Arthur Rinderknech in the Qatar Open first round.

item.title: Raducanu beaten by lucky loser in Dubai first round
item.description: British number one Emma Raducanu is knocked out of the Dubai Tennis Championships in the first round by lucky loser Antonia Ruzic.

item.title: Tennis 'racist, misogynistic, homophobic', says Aiava
item.description: Australian player Destanee Aiava says tennis has a "racist, misogynistic, homophobic and hostile" culture as she announces her retirement from the sport at 25.

item.title: Muchova defeats teenager Mboko to win Qatar Open
item.description: Karolina Muchova clinches her first title since 2019 as she overcomes Canadian teenager Victoria Mboko in the Qatar Open final.

item.title: Serena Williams can return from 22 February - but will she?
item.description: American great Serena Williams is eligible to return to competition on 22 February when she will have completed the reinstatement process.

item.title: Pinnington Jones' dream Dallas run ended by Cilic
item.description: Great Britain's Jack Pinnington Jones has his dream run at the Dallas Open ended by veteran Marin Cilic in the quarter-finals.

item.title: Boulter seals fourth WTA title with Ostrava Open win
item.description: Britain's Katie Boulter claims her fourth WTA Tour title with a three-set victory against Tamara Korpatsch at the Ostrava Open on Saturday.

item.title: 'Winning by being here' - Draper triumphs on injury return
item.description: Jack Draper says he is "winning by being here" as he makes an emphatic return to help Great Britain take control of their Davis Cup qualifying tie against Norway.

item.title: Five sets for women? More entertainment? - where does 'Glastonbury of tennis' go next?
item.description: Once dubbed the 'Happy Slam' by Roger Federer, the innovative Australian Open has gone from strength to strength - but there have been signs of discontent.

item.title: Raducanu well beaten in Transylvania Open final
item.description: Emma Raducanu's bid to win a first title since her US Open triumph in 2021 ends in a heavy defeat by Sorana Cirstea in the final of the Transylvania Open.

item.title: Cash & Glasspool avoid scare as GB beat Norway
item.description: Julian Cash and Lloyd Glasspool avoid a huge scare to put Great Britain into the final round of Davis Cup qualifying with a 3-0 win over Norway.

item.title: Happy tennis, serious name - the making of Carlos Alcaraz
item.description: Before Carlos Alcaraz became the youngest man to complete the career Grand Slam, he was simply Carlitos from Murcia. This is his story.

item.title: Djokovic 'still believes' - but how many Slams does he have left?
item.description: A gallant defeat in the Australian Open final showed Novak Djokovic is still among the very best - but he does not know what the future holds.

item.title: Tennis immortality at 22 - numbers behind Alcaraz's historic win
item.description: The key statistics and numbers behind Carlos Alcaraz's historic Australian Open victory.

item.title: Alcaraz beats Djokovic to become youngest man to complete career Grand Slam
item.description: Carlos Alcaraz wins the Australian Open to become the youngest man to complete a career Grand Slam - ending Novak Djokovic's latest attempt to land a 25th major title.

item.title: 'She basically capitulated' - is Sabalenka underachieving at Slams?
item.description: After losing another Grand Slam final - this time to Elena Rybakina at the Australian Open - BBC Sport asks if Aryna Sabalenka is underachieving at the majors.

item.title: Raducanu wins first match since split from coach
item.description: Emma Raducanu records her first win since out-of-sorts Australian Open performance and split from coach Francis Roig.

item.title: Rybakina's rise to a Slam four years in the making
item.description: Why 'unstoppable' Elena Rybakina will believe her Australian Open triumph can begin a period of sustained success after ending a four-year wait for her second major title.

item.title: GB's Skupski wins Australian Open doubles title
item.description: Great Britain's Neal Skupski and American partner Christian Harrison win the Australian Open men's doubles title in their first Grand Slam together.

item.title: 'I'm always the chaser?' - Djokovic unimpressed by reporter's question
item.description: 24-time Grand Slam winner Novak Djokovic says he felt "disrespectful" after being asked how he felt "chasing" Jannik Sinner and Carlos Alcaraz, after previously "chasing" Roger Federer and Rafael Nadal during the early parts of his career.

item.title: 'Are we animals in the zoo?' - Top tennis players call for more privacy
item.description: Jessica Pegula, Iga Swiatek and Novak Djokovic have all supported Coco Gauff's concerns over the use of cameras away from the court at the Australian Open, insisting more privacy is needed for all players competing.

item.title: 'I don't want to give myself too much of a hard time'
item.description: British number one Emma Raducanu says she is leaving the Australian Open with her "head held high" after losing 7-6 (7-3) 6-2 to Austria's Anastasia Potapova in the second round.

item.title: Watch: Amateur beats Sinner in One Point Slam title win
item.description: Watch amateur tennis player beat men's world number two Jannik Sinner and women's world number 117 Joanna Garland to earn A$1m (Â£496,835) in Australian Open's new Million Dollar One Point Slam.

item.title: Kyrgios defeats Sabalenka in 'Battle of the Sexes'
item.description: Watch the best moments between Aryna Sabalenka and Nick Kyrgios at the Battle of the Sexes in Dubai.

item.title: Surviving bombs and hunger to become a professional tennis player
item.description: Tennis is seen as a rich sport. But many stars, including Novak Djokovic and Elina Svitolina, have forged successful careers from humble beginnings.

item.title: Is Sinner-Alcaraz in danger of making majors boring?
item.description: Though the Carlos Alcaraz and Jannik Sinner rivalry is thrilling, tennis correspondent Russell Fuller ponders whether it could make Grand Slams boring.

item.title: Why Norrie exit underlines how Britain is punching below weight
item.description: Britain is one of the richest tennis nations in the world but once again its singles players have not reached the second week at a Grand Slam.

item.title: Players at 'high risk' as tennis chases sun
item.description: With high temperatures and very high UV levels at the Australian Open, BBC Sport looks at the effects of playing for hours outdoors.

item.title: Raducanu's 'most dispiriting' Slam display - what went wrong?
item.description: After Emma Raducanu suffered a humbling Australian Open second-round exit, BBC Sport analyses where the Briton goes next.

item.title: How popularity overwhelmed Eala - and the Australian Open
item.description: Alexandra Eala may have only played one Australian Open singles match but she was the biggest first-round draw by far at Melbourne Park.

item.title: More money and bigger say - are top-10 stars being reasonable?
item.description: As another Grand Slam season dawns, many players still believe they are undervalued and denied a voice in key decisions made by the majors.

item.title: 'Point of the match!' - Sabalenka hits 'amazing' winner against Kyrgios
item.description: Aryna Sabalenka hits an 'amazing' return against Nick Kyrgios at the Battle of the Sexes in Dubai.

item.title: 1973 Battle of the Sexes was about social change - King
item.description: American tennis legend Billie Jean King says the upcoming 'Battle of the Sexes' match between Aryna Sabalenka and Nick Kyrgios is "not the same" as her 1973 victory over Bobby Riggs.

item.title: Sabalenka confident 'Battle of the Sexes' won't damage women's sport
item.description: BBC Sport speaks to Aryna Sabalenka and Nick Kyrgios about their controversial Battle of the Sexes-style match, set to take place in Dubai on 28 December.

item.title: Women's tennis going in right direction - King
item.description: Billie Jean King, founder of the WTA, believes the organisation's billion-dollar deal with Mercedes shows the tour "continues to lead the way" in women's sport.

item.title: Boulter loses to Pegula as GB out of BJK Cup
item.description: Watch the best shots, as the United States' Jessica Pegula fights back from a set down to beat Katie Boulter and knock Great Britain out of the Billie Jean King Cup at the semi-final stage.

item.title: GB's Kartal runs Navarro close in BJK Cup semi-final
item.description: A battling Sonay Kartal falls to the United States' Emma Navarro, as Great Britain go 1-0 down in the semi-finals of the Billie Jean King Cup.

item.title: Boulter win puts GB into BJK Cup semi-finals
item.description: Watch the best shots, as Katie Boulter's win over Moyuka Uchijima sees Great Britain secure a 2-0 win over Japan, setting up a Billie Jean King Cup semi-final with the United States.

item.title: GB's Kartal dominates Shibahara in BJK Cup match win
item.description: Watch the best shots, as Sonay Kartal beats Ena Shibahara of Japan to give Great Britain a 1-0 lead in their Billie Jean King Cup quarter-final tie.

item.title: Borg will fight cancer 'like it's a Wimbledon final'
item.description: Tennis legend Bjorn Borg says "I hope I'm gonna be OK" after being diagnosed with "extremely aggressive" prostate cancer.

item.title: How will GB cope without Raducanu in BJK Cup?
item.description: Emma Raducanu is missing the Billie Jean King Cup to focus on the WTA Tour.

item.title: Alcaraz overcomes Sinner to win US Open
item.description: Carlos Alcaraz triumphs in the latest chapter of his compelling rivalry with Jannik Sinner, earning a four-set victory to regain the US Open title.

item.title: Who has won tennis' 'Battle of the Sexes'?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team details the history of 'Battle of the Sexes' matches in tennis

item.title: What is US Open prize money?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team looks at how much prize money is on offer at the US Open.

item.title: Why is there a pineapple on Wimbledon's men's trophy?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team looks at why there is a pineapple on the top of the Wimbledon trophy for the winner of the men's singles.

item.title: Why were there no line judges at Wimbledon 2025?
item.description: Wimbledon are relying on electronic line calling to judge whether a ball is in or out.
